sourcesContent:
import React, {useState} from "react"; class Stacks extends React.Component { constructor() { super(); this.state = { stacks: { react: true, angular: false, vue: false, noBackend: true, nodejsTypeORM: false, nodejsSequeslize: false, postgreSQL: true, mySQL: false }, appName: {name: true} }; } handleClick = (event) => { const { name, checked } = event.target; this.setState((prevState) => { const stacks = prevState.stacks; stacks[name] = checked; return stacks; }); }; render() { const selectedStacks = Object.keys(this.state.stacks) .filter((key) => this.state.stacks[key]) .join(", "); const appName = Object.keys(this.state.appName) const onChange = e => { appName = e.target.value; } return (
Application Name

Frontend

React

React is a frontend library used to create stateful and reusable UI components for developing large web applications.

Angular

Angular quickly established itself as a mainstream technology used by millions of developers.

Vue

Vue.js is a progressive framework for building user interfaces. Vue was built to be incrementally adoptable for users.

Backend (Ready-to-use admin interface/CRUD app)

No Backend

Application without backend and database, only with front-end. 'create-react-app' for example.

Node js + TypeORM

Application without backend and database, only with front-end. 'create-react-app' for example.

Node js + Sequeslize

Application without backend and database, only with front-end. 'create-react-app' for example.

Database

PostgreSQL

Application without backend and database, only with front-end. 'create-react-app' for example.

MySQL

Application without backend and database, only with front-end. 'create-react-app' for example.

Application Name: {appName}

Your stacks are: {selectedStacks}

); } } export default Stacks;
